timeline.description:
Home office setup - version 2021
MacBook Air M1 is üî•

I've started part-time remote work at [CoachNow](https://coachnow.io) company

My main responsibility here is to support the [CoachNow app](https://apps.apple.com/app/coachnow-coaching-platform/id596598472) (iOS and iPadOS) and add new features.
It's an app with a long history (7+ years) and mixed codebase (Objective C and Swift) with a lot of dependencies.

I'm started working as an **iOS apps Developer** at [Clowder](https://www.clowder.com/) company. First fully remote job.
*My mission* here is to support **50+ projects** (iOS apps).

I'm finished working at App Dev Academy, 4+ years of work.
I worked there as **Software Developer**, building apps for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.
Here I took a part in developing, publishing, and supporting **more than 10 iOS apps** and **1 macOS app**.

On this day I made my first commit üéâ

TechCrunch about PROVEIT - [Bet money on yourself with Proveit, the 1-vs-1 trivia app](https://techcrunch.com/2018/06/18/proveit-trivia)

timeline.comment:
**July 2016 - February 2017**
Some other small apps for iOS

timeline.description:
Started working on a new iOS app - [Chronograph](https://apps.apple.com/app/chronograph/id1281918814)
In-house application (App Dev Academy) with time tracking and task management.

*My role:*
- Design iOS app architecture and create an app from scratch
- Design **CoreData** database architecture
- Implement custom layout of the "timer" and "clock" + **iPad version** of the app
- **Shared codebase** between iOS and macOS versions of the app

timeline.title: Cashbox
timeline.description:
*The main challenges for me here was:*
- Implement sync with **remove API** and store data on the device using **CoreData**
- Implement UI with charts and **iPad support**
- Codebase on **Swift** 1 and 2 (still raw and evolving at that time)

Started working on a new macOS app - [Chronograph](https://apps.apple.com/ua/app/chronograph-my-productivity/id1316023026?mt=12)
In-house application (App Dev Academy) with time tracker that allows you to work by ‚ÄúPomodoro technique‚Äù and plan your tasks.

*Role and responsibilities:*
- Design macOS app architecture and create an app from scratch
- Design **CoreData** database architecture
- Implement background sync with remove server via **REST API**
- Write code on **Swift** programming language
- Use the latest Apple frameworks - **UIKit**, **SwiftUI**, etc.
Started working with App Dev Academy, a small company of people from *Sumy, Ukraine*.

Started working on [SumDU](https://apps.apple.com/ua/app/id698235283)
This is the first iOS app, published in the App Store, that I'm working on.
Souce code on GitHub - [sumdu-ios](https://github.com/appdev-academy/sumdu-ios)

For me, the *main challenge* here was to implement a **custom navigation bar** with nice and **smooth animation**. And implement a custom layout for the **iPad version** of the app.

Finished working at [bvblogic](https://bvblogic.com), 3 years and 7 months
I build websites on **PHP** programming language, using frameworks such as **Laravel**, **Kohana**, **Codeigniter**, **Yii**. Also, I used **CSS3**, **HTML5**, **jQuery**, and **Bootstrap** for the frontend.
First experience of building and supporting commercial projects.

timeline.comment: June 2014 - Apple has announced the **Swift** programming language
